Never give up.

2A Software Engineer at the University of Waterloo.


SKILLS SUMMARY

LANGUAGES
Proficient in Python, C and C++.
Some experience in C#, SQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery.
TOOLS
Familiar working in Microsoft Office, Adobe Photoshop, Microsoft Visual Studio and Oracle SQL Developer.


EDUCATION

Candidate for Bachelor's of Software Engineering, Honours
Sept. 2011 - present
  ▪ Software Engineering, University of Waterloo, Ontario


WORK EXPERIENCE

Quality Assurance Analyst, NexJ Systems Inc., Toronto, Ontario
May 2012 - Aug. 2012
  ▪ Coded SQL queries to run regression tests between databases and UI screens.
  ▪ Wrote large test plans with test cases defining the boundaries of the new software customizations.
  ▪ Performed functional testing of new features following the pre-defined test cases.

Math Assistant, Kumon Agincourt North, Toronto, Ontario
Sept. 2009 - July 2011
  ▪ Graded 30 students' homework a day while providing assistance with upcoming work.


PROJECTS

Sept. 2012 - present
  ▪ C++ Assembler for the MIPS assembly language.
  ▪ Working towards writing a lexer, parser, and compiler.

Offline Site Export
Sept. 2012 - present
  ▪ Python application to move webpages offline with minimal disruption.

Extended Beyond Compare 3 Launcher
June 2012 - Aug. 2012
  ▪ wxPython application designed based on QA requirements at NexJ for PDF analysis.
  ▪ Integrated PDF-to-text ability and specific text comparison methods.
  ▪ Enforced use of class-based object oriented programming in panel inheritance.

OpenGLUT Tic-Tac-Toe
May 2012 - July 2012
  ▪ 2D game developed using the OpenGLUT extension for OpenGL.
  ▪ Included randomized AI, multiple difficulties, and unbeatable expert-level AI.

Texas Hold'em Poker
April 2012 - present
  ▪ C++ console Poker with multiple hand strength analysis.

Lego Robot Project, Introduction to Methods of Software Engineering, University of Waterloo
Sept. 2011 - Dec. 2011
  ▪ Led programming of automatic path finding and correction algorithm in Lego's Not Quite C language.


AWARDS

Mechanical Transporter Team, McMaster University Engineering and Science Olympics
Oct. 2010
  ▪ Built gravity-propelled wooden car with K'Nex wheels and a custom braking solution.
  ▪ Design allowed car to stop within 1.8cm of a target 3m from the base of a 60cm ramp.
  ▪ Awarded scholarship by McMaster University for 1st place of 40 competing schools.


HOBBIES
